11113121121111121111111121211211131.content:
You sat quietly observing in the palm of the giant marimiut, unsure if you should speak freely or still hold you tongue in his presence. Sure, he assured you that you were an equal, but the concept was so...foreign. He glided gracefully over the fresh fallen snow as he made his way around the igloos and tents that made up the Marimiut tribe. He passed others of his kind, who bowed out of his way and eyed you with fascination or hostility. He reached a tent larger than all the others which you assumed was yours and slid inside. You let out a breath you didn't know you had been holding and took in another sharp one when Mishka spoke.

         "So this ability of yours....it's induced by stress? A kind of fight or flight response perhaps?" Mishka said lowering you to some furs near the firepit that smoldered in the center of the room.

         You hopped off and watched him go to a rack that a salmon fish hung from, he snapped it from the line and made his way back over and sat down near you. He drew a knife from somewhere and filleted the fish with insane swiftness and precision, slicing off thin strips of raw flesh and setting them between the two of you. He tossed the rest of the fish onto the smoldering embers where the fish's oils oozed and sizzled. He gestured to the raw slices and you hesitantly came forward and tore a scrap away from one, eating it in a cautious manner. Eating raw food was not a new concept for you, but you always had preferred the opportunity to eat cooked meat, but you didn't want to be rude and ignore the appetizer while you waited on the main dish to cook.

         "I assume so...although now that I think of it...I did control Bone, at least his limbs while he focused on breathing when we came here."
         "Ah so you can control it, I must say you are wasted with the Smilotuk, your value will never truly show among their dull ranks." Marimut said popping a slice of fish in his mouth, his ice eyes not leaving you for a moment.
         "I-I'm unsure, Thorn seemed to know I could, but I still have my doubts."
You say honestly.
         "Then let's absolve you of that." He states. "Merge with me, Pup."
Mishka says leaning forward. You pale.
         "Wh-what? No! It feels wrong. Good....but so wrong. No I won't merge with you an I ask that you respect that."
You state it firmly but politely. The look that pops in Mishkas eyes freezes your blood, but only for a moment before he breaks in a genuine smile.
         "I'm sorry Pup, but you may be the answer to our war, and I can't let your modesty get in the way at the chance of peace."
         Before you can react those pearled claws grabbed your fur tunic and hoisted you above the Behemoth, his fangs parting and below you is utter darkness, hot air escapes it smelling of fish and some previous meal. You squirm in the grasp as Mishka lowers you. You knew what he was doing, but the terror of actually being eaten again welled inside you, damning your prey drive to madness. You screamed and kicked, only for Mishka to lower you quicker. You shut your eyes hard to avert the terror you feel, and when you open them...you aren't sure if you feel better or even worse.
         MY MY, WELCOME TO THE MIND OF MISHKA PUP
         Time is frozen. From your eyes you see your own self, dangling limply from the clawed fingers of an arm that led to your body. You weren't being lowered anymore, rather left dangling, suspended by the conflict of interest within the brain of the Marimiut.
         Let's see how strong you are truly.
         With a sudden start, the arm spasmed and began to lower your dangling body again towards the open jaws that you couldn't close.
         NO
         The muscles swelled and relaxed, two wills sending commands to the arm as it jerked back and forth, sending your body dancing in a very stomach churning fashion. Mishka's voice laughed in merriment, obviously pleased with the results and picking up intensity, but you were getting to your limit. He knew his own body better than you, and he was going to eat you. You had to think fast. And you did. You stop sending signals to the arm holding you.
         Is that all Pup, I must say that's rather-
         His mental gloating was cut off as you commanded the other arm that rested on his knee to punch him square in the jaw. Effectively ending the charade as your body flew into a pile of furs. Your mind followed and you came to shortly after your landing, gasping in air as you sit up to look at the stunned Marimiut. He blinks his eyes and dabs his lip to see his own blood. He stayed in that position for a second before laughing quite merrily.
         "I-I sup-pose I d-deserved that" He said between chuckles and wipes a tear from his eye before focusing on you again with a warm smile.
         "I apologize for the rude and uncanny test, I had no real intention to eat you, but if I didn't try there would be no way I'd ever get the result I seeked."
         "I can't forgive you sadly Mishka, I did not enjoy the ordeal." You say lifting your chin, taking in shaky breaths. His smile waned.
         "You...You're correct to resent me, and be that as it may, I still am unsure about letting you leave with Ata-...Bone Snapper. He seems to lack the fundamentals and...intelligence to properly use your ability."
         "That isn't your call to make Mishka, it's mine." You say crossing your arms and makin him smile warmly again. He almost whispers the next sentence, a note of jealousy in it.
         "You love him don't you Pup?" You go bright red as he states this.
         "Wha...NO I mean...." you take a deep breath. "Yes."
         The Marimiut bowed his head in surrender, and without another word he pulled the fish from the embers. The two of you ate in silence and finished. After awhile he slowly began to discuss things like the weather and history of his clan. You gave him the stink eye but after a while you dropped the act and began to have genuine conversations with him. He explained as well that when a chief becomes to old, he simply steps down, and that the strongest and smartest Marimiut fills the role until he becomes too old. You find this system to be way more functional than the Smilotuk's, where they lead until one of their own kills them.
         After awhile the dinner drum beats through the camp with a resounding boom, and the Bear picks you up and carries you out to an open area that had many fires that roasted many feral game. As you are taken to a fire, Mishka places you on his shoulder and converses with his people on many matters. You soon grow tired of listening and soon spot Bone and Kilak approaching. Bone limped, but it wasn't necessarily from his leg wound it seemed. They took their seats near Mishka, Bone yelping a little as his large rear hit the frozen dirt.
         "Atanik, glad to see you walking so well after such a long recovery." Mishka said smiling at him.
         "Aye" Is the only response he got from the large Smilotuk as Bone stared at you longingly. Mishka caught this and slipped a hand up to transfer you back to Bone.
         "Pup here is quite the fiery spirit Atanik, your lucky to have him by your side." Mishka said in a voice that was slightly contemptuous.
         "That 'e is, I ain't never met one quite like 'em." Bone said reaching out a hand and taking you back, bringing you in close where you could hug his large chest, Kilak spat nearby at the sight.
         The fire's burned high into the night sky where the northern lights, the bridges to the Far Lands, danced with the smoke. Bone didn't speak much to you as he conversed with the Marimiut, but an occasional thumb stroked you, letting you know that you weren't forgotten....
11113121121111121111111121211211131.title: Off to Pup and Mishka's POV.

111131211211111211111111212112111312.content:
(In continuing with where Key left off with the vocabulary and proper names of species. Elk is now called "Wapiti".)

         It wasn't long after the event with Mishka that Bone was wanting to be off. You were actually interacting with the Marimiut as if you were an equal, though whether the interaction was positive or negative boiled down to the age of the tribe member. Older one's around Kilak's age were prone to aggression, and seemed to want to eat you and be done with it. Younger Marimiut actually held conversations with you and asked about your abilities and your thoughts on everything. Either way this much exposure was a little jarring for you, seeing as how less than a week ago Gliron was the only person in your life that you talked to. Your days were mostly spent in the hut with Bone, using your size to deftly clean his wounds where Kilak missed and generally snuggling up to the Big Cat to keep warm. He had gone from his usual nonchalant and abrasive personality to one that was akin to a selfish lover when you were alone with him. Kilak wasn't really welcome in the hut when you were not with Mishka, and when you asked Bone why he'd turn red and tell you to not worry about it. Today was like the past two, slow with nothing but Bones fever and frustration to heat up.

         "This ain' right, Aye need'a be off and home, not here with that big snowball eye fuckin' me" Bone said propped up on an elbow while you cleaned his thigh wound. It had healed fantastically , and besides the occasional muscle spasm, Bone's leg was no doubt going to fully recover. You worked under the shadow of his clothed bulge, his cloth smelling of some scented grass the bears used to clean their cloth and bodies. Bone had stated several times that he needed to coat the thing in some Amaruq or Wapiti blood soon, he hated it being spotless, it made it 'virgin'.
         "You're almost healed, walking and fighting now could reverse all of what Kilak and the Marimiut have done for you."
         "Fuck em'"
         "I'm getting the idea that you already did." You say, and watch the bulge near you twitch slightly.
         "THAT AIN"T NONAYA BUSINESS PUP." Bone said sitting up more and jabbing a claw at you, resting it an inch from your sternum. You didn't flinch however and Bone noticed that. he put his ears back and narrowed his eyes.
         You were about to reply but a sound gave you pause. A Wapiti bugle rang out on the afternoon air, echoing off the trees and plains around the camp. A moment later the sound of Marimiut's crashing around outside could be heard and Kilak came stumbling in.

         "Bone...the Wapiti have gathered, we may need you..." He said looking at you and nodding without scowling or saying something demeaning. This must be serious then. The Marimiut didn't let Bone answer as he tossed him a spear and departed the tent. You look at Bone in fear, and he just smiled at you.

         "The fights ne'er over Lad." He said picking you up and setting you to the side as he stood up, using the spear as a walking stick to keep it off his bad leg.
         "Bone, can I try a bond with you? If this becomes an altercation I want to remain in contact." You say pleadingly.
         Bone pauses and scratches the back of his head in an awkward fashion, you and him had discussed what you knew about bonds, but Bone was not a fan of sharing his headspace with you. You told him you aren't privy to anything he doesn't share. You had been wanting to practice them, but Mishka said you need time between him and you before being able to establish one due to the animosity you still hold against him, and Thorn was probably just reaching the Smilotuk camp by now so he wouldn't be back to explain them. That left Bone...

         "Errr...sure laddie..." He said plucking you up and opening his mouth slightly. "So...do I eat ya or..."
         "Just put me on your tongue and lets go from there." You say confidently, but really you had no clue what you were doing, you were grasping at straws.
         Bone opened his mouth and placed you on his tongue, you tried to ignore the black abyss at the back of his throat and closed your eyes as he closed his mouth, sealing you in darkness. You took in a deep breath of the stale rancid air and reached out with your conscious, or so you thought you were. A minute passes of nothing but wet squelching of Bones tongue fidgeting beneath you and the distant pulsing of his great heart.
         "Sooo are ya in myy mindth yeth.." Bone said sending you sliding around between his jagged teeth.
         "No! Quit talking I can't-" The muffled sound of a tent flap could be heard followed by a familiar voice.
         "Uncle Atanik? We need you outside the village! There's at least two dozen Wapiti gathered outside and maybe three dozen more in the trees. They've elected an official to communicate what they want, but I need all men to gather with me to show some solidarity and that we aren't afraid." Mishka's voice said. The Wapiti are threatening the Marimiut? This isn't good. Bone's tongue juggled you out of your thoughts.
         "Are ye truly scared o' a bunch of bark munchers?" He managed by pushing you into a cheek. Even from in his mouth you could feel the cold gaze Mishka had fixed on Bone.
         "Hardly, but a fight with them would be quite the setback, especially with the Berserk Marimiut's coming back into the region. Get out here....and get Pup out of your mouth..." He said before the sound of a tent flap closing resounded.
         You were spat out into an awaiting palm and Bone shrugged at you before walking out after Mishka. He set you on his shoulder and walked out onto the ice field where dark figures with large antlers awaited, clubs and arrow tips made from their shedded antlers from winters past. One stood beyond them, he wore no clothes except for a leather strap that held a stone knife to his hip, his more personal bits exposed and being ruffled by the wind. His antlers were half his body length and had what looked like wolf teeth tied to string hanging from the points.
         "That lad knows how ta walk about" Bone observed appreciatively, you just looked at him questioningly as he sauntered up next to Kilak and Mishka.
         The Bull Wapiti looked at Bone and narrowed his eyes before stepping forward until he was about 10 feet from Mishka. The Bull was shorter than Bone and the Marimiut, but his antlers made him taller in general. He spoke with a strange musical tone.
         "Greetings Ice Brothers, I am the Great Famorn, of the Uttering Bark herd, the Conglomeration has elected me to state our purpose for the intrusion, though you most definitely have an idea what we want." He said letting his gaze focus on Bone again. Mishka spoke.
         "Hail speaker of the Trees, yes I assume you want to take Bone Snapper of the Smilotuks for payment of blood. I am sorry to say we swore the oath of protection, and can not and will not relinquish this oath until he is safely back with his clan." Mishka said, his voice calm but strong in its message.
         "I implore you, no one will look on the act of relinquishment as dishonorable, he wiped out nearly all the males in the Dark Wood herd, and Alpha Regish wants to make his bones into trophies." Famorn said withouot breaking his gaze on Bone, who snorted in response.
         "If this Regish wan's a fight, I'll give em' one, where is he?" Bone said eyeing the bulls beyond Famorn, then shifted his gaze to the tree line. Famorn spat in his direction which made Bone swivel back and growl as the Bull spoke.
         "He is occupied with....replinishing his sons. But the matter is more than simple blood for blood, you negotiated with the Amaruq and we perceive that as the possibility of an alliance, which is hostility towards the Wapiti. If the Smilotuk end their fights with the Amaruq, and instead ally with one another, you are now our enemy, if the Marimiut want to protect you, then they are as well." The Alpha Bull stated looking back at Mishka, who took the lull to speak again.
         "Can the Wapiti really afford a war with three clans?" Mishka asked.
         "Yes"
         "How?"
         Famorn smiled again. "We have allies too. Either way, turn over the Smilotuk, or both Marimiut AND Smilotuk can expect the woods to no longer be their friend in their hunts. You have until the Sky's eye reaches the earth's horizon." Famorn said turning and walking away.
         Bone gulped, it being audible with you on his shoulder, and you didn't blame him. His life is now putting hundreds of others at risk. He turned to look over at Mishka, who was still staring after the Bull.
         "Err, Nanuk Mishka?" Bone posed.
         "No Uncle, we are not letting you walk out to them. When the sun sets, we're getting you back home, and then we go to war." Mishka said without turning around. "Kilak, send a runner to inform the Amaruq that we and the Smilotuk are about to be attacked by the Wapiti, and they may have an opportunity to hit them from behind when we do engage them."
         Mishka turned and locked eyes with you, his gaze softening and giving you a smile before walking back into camp. Bone sighed and shuffled his feet, obviously pissed that he was being viewed as something that need to be protected.

Welcome to the club... you thought to yourself.

What club? Bones voice rang in your head and you blinked in surprise...
111131211211111211111111212112111312.title: The Elk get bold

1111312112111112111111112121121113121.content:
Wapiti bugles rang in the light of Dusk as the Sun disappeared beneath the horizon. Bone limped after Kilak and another Marimut named Happai as they traversed an ice tunnel the bears had dug underneath one of their tents.

         "This ain' the way I do things, Kilak. Lemme kill some Wapiti with you." Bone said, you still sitting on his shoulder. "I needa restain mah cloth anyhow."

         "Mishka has spoken, you aren't worth much in a fight with the state you are in. Besides we need to establish the alliance with the Smilotuk, and you dead won't help with that."

         "Thorn was doin' that anywho."

         "No...Thorn was establishing your alliance with the Amaruq, you're in charge of our alliance." Kilak said.

         The group went another few feet before Happai kicked out a thin sheet of ice and revealed a glacial stream, shallow as it flowed underneath the ice sheet and most likely into the river that they would follow home. Happai leaped down and continued and Kilak followed, Bone leaped down but his leg buckled, still not strong enough for physical activity. Kilak balanced him.

         "Careful Atanik, take it slow." The bear said as Bone shouldered him off.

         "Don' think you can get all handsy jus' cuz ye took advantage of me." Bone said scoffing and hobbling onward. You rose an eyebrow and looked at Bone but he didn't return the gaze. Kilak however did.

         "Bone here is just used to being top human, I'm pretty sure that's what it is." He said, smiling at the scowl Bone turned on him.

         Light came through an opening up ahead and the Ice cave opened up on a rocky beach next to quite the violent river. Bone's tribe called it the Land Tear.

         "Half a night's travel and we should be home for breakfast." Bone said longingly. You were looking forward to home as well, maybe you'd be able to see your father again if Bone permitted it. A nearby Elk bugle rang out of the river from the forest on the other side and everyone froze. After a moment Kilak spoke.

         "We have to move fast, the farther we get, the less likely we will have to fight."Kilak said handing Bone a spear, inferring it more to be a walking stick rather than a weapon.

         The wind was strong on the bank and threatened to blow you off Bone's shoulder, their breechcloths danced wildly, being held only the leather belt they looped over. The cloth runs over it, before covering the crotch and running into the ass, then back over the leather belt again so it can hang out the back, it was the only form of modesty that these titans deigned to possess. Kilaks own cloth covered package was left for you to stare at as the wind whipped his cloth horizontally, Happai was already walking ahead and was giving everyone a full view of his rear.

         "Ye strugglin' lad?" Bone asked. You hadn't said anything, but you had still managed to establish a weak bond with the Smilotuk. He wasn't getting many thoughts, but he could sense distress and emotion of you, though you doubted he realized that.

         "I'll be fine, just focus on your steps. I'll let you know if...I need to go downstairs." You say as Bone chuckled and began trekking home.

         The wind died down some as the party made it around the bend in a river...and right into view of a Wapiti outpost that was on the other side of the river. There was no doubt that they were there for the sole purpose of monitoring the banks for them fleeing. Kilak noticed them first and only had a split second to lean back a bit as an arrow trimmed some fur off his neck. A bugle rang out, and a second later another one picked up the call as the forest came alive with hundreds of Bugles. A call of War.
         Bone yelped as Happai sweeped him up like a damsel in distress and began running after Kilak through a rain of arrows. You slipped from Bone, yelping as you did only to latch on to the Marimut's leather belt on his hip. You struggled and partially wedged yourself into the belt as Kilak let out a growl as his ear was nicked by a passing arrow. The Land Tear widened as they ran, and arrows were finding it harder to reach their quarry with the distance and wind. Eventually the Wapiti gave up for now, a single mournful call ringing out across the waters.

         "That was too easy..."Kilak noted as Happai put Bone back down, who stared at the Marimut with utter distaste. Bone reached down an plucked you from Happai's hip, who blinked in surprise, not realizing you were there.
         Bone placed you on his shoulder and the Smilotuk continued forward, taking the lead despite Kilaks protests. A few hours passed in silence and soon enough Bone drifted from the river and crested a hill, looking down on the rounded camp that sat in the middle of a snow field, home. Bone took in a breath of relief, as did you.

         "This is where we leave you Ata-...Bone Snapper. Our people need us, and yours need you. We will see each other again soon." Kilak said, and Bone nodded, clasping hands with the Marimut and pulling him in for a long kiss. Happai and you turn away, both embarrassed by the action. They broke it off and Bone snorted.

         "Next time...I'm gettin' top." The Smilotuk announced and turned, walking down the hill and onto the plains...

...

         The camp was another few minutes walk, you had never seen it from such a distance so the scale of it tricked you into thinking it was closer. The wind was picking up and whipping Bone's breechcloth around his waist as he walked into the gale. It was due to this wind that he didn't hear the heavy footsteps until they were right up on him. Bone whipped around to find a pale grey Wapiti charging him with sharp antlers angled at his chest. Bone took a stance, dropping his spear and braced to receive the charge, grasping the horns of the Large Bull and sliding through the snow a few feet before coming to a halt. They stayed like that for a second, Bone wincing from his leg, The Wapiti huffing with bloodshot eyes staring up past his antlers at Bone. You hung onto Bone with renewed fear, which seemed to seep through your bond as it flickered across Bones face. He maintained composure however.

"Ye must be that Alpha Ragish lad." Bone inquired. "In mah defense, yer boys attacked us." In response the Bull threw his head to the side, making it where Bone would brace on his bad leg.
         Bone couldn't support the weight and was sent tumbling through the snow, grunting in pain as you fell off into the snow as well. You sat up, shaking flakes from your head as the Bull stomped past you, his foot crashing inches from you, his gaze set on Bone. Your Smilotuk stood up slowly.

         "Ye know...this would be over already if it weren't for mah leg." Boomer said, his ears flattening and him drawing back his lips to expose his fangs. Ragish charged him again, but Bone dove forward and went under the horns, flipping the Bull by coming up into his stomach. As the Bull fell, Bone dove on top of him, raking the Wapiti with punches and claws. For something so intimidating, Ragish wasn't much once Bone got past the antlers. That was until Bone lunged for the neck, only for the Wapiti to lash his head forward. One of his antlers punched into Bones right eye and the Smilotuk tumbled back grasping at his face, blood leaking between the finger tips.
         Bone made a sound that made your skin crawl as he obviously had just lost his sight in that eye. Ragish rolled the Cat off of him and followed, ending up being on top as he took his time delivering heavy blows to the half blind Smilotuk. Despite the injury, Bone began delivering blows himself back at the Wapiti. The slug fest was a battle of Stamina, and Bone was going to lose. Ragish threw a punch across Bone's face, knocking the Cat out as you sensed it over your weak link with him. The Bull huffed, drawing an antler knife from his waist and drawing it back to punch it into the Smilotuks chest.
         You closed your eyes and focused your hatred on the Wapiti, your hate synchronizing with the Bull's own, and when you opened your eyes you were looking down at a beaten Bone. The arms froze as you sent messages to them, and a voice quickly rang through your mind.

         Human, let me have this and I won't turn you into a stain in the snow.

         A powerful pressure surrounded you, this guy was like Thorn! You struggled to maintain the hold of the arms, but they slowly crept closer to the Smilotuk's heaving chest. You looked elsewhere, like you had with Mishka, but the consciousness of the Bull was split, he was able to prevent you from taking over other parts of his body. So instead you invested everything, everything you had into the arms. They bent slightly, now angling towards Ragish. A ethereal chuckle rang out as the Bull played with you, despite you feeling your own being burning up to maintain control. Mental anguish washed over you, a pain that wasn't physical, but hurt all the same. You thought you were about to fade when in the corner of the Wapiti's eyes a hand shot up from Bone and slammed the hilt of the knife into Ragish's chest. The Bull choked, and his mind exploded into a world of memories and regrets, threatening to absorb you into them. Somewhere Bone's voice reached you...

"Pup....PUP....Get outta of 'is head Pup! C'mon Lad!" You followed the voice down a dark tunnel, and when you emerged you were staring at the face of Bone from the palm of his hand, blood trickled from his clenched right eye.
         Bone made a very strange noise as he let a sob loose. He turned his gaze to the dying Ragish, and both of you watched as he drowned on is own blood. Bone hobbled to his feet, and limped towards camp...
1111312112111112111111112121121113121.title: The great escape begins

11113121121111121111111121211211131211.content:
Bone limped onto the hill overlooking the camp. Immediately he felt something was off, and from him, you picked up on it as well. You would’ve asked what the problem was, but at this point, you were so fed up with the constant conflict that you didn’t want to anymore. A snowflake landed on your redded nose, they floated downward from the clouds of midnight, the sky illuminated in a hazy purple by moonlight. Banks of snow muffled the surrounding forest.

         “There’s always shit getting thrown at us from somewhere, right?”

         Bone smiled then nodded. Still, whatever was wrong, rushing into it would be a bad idea. Bone couldn’t afford to waste energy in his injured state. The rapidly decreasing temperature of tundra at nightfall meant you would lose warmth quickly, so standing idle wasn’t ideal either. The burning of frost was apparent as he clutched his freshly opened eye socket.

         “...Bone,” you peered up at him, clasping his burly thumb, “better to go in safe than sorry. I wanna try linking with you again.”

         He huffed. “Weh tried, ‘member? Didnae work…”

         “Actually, I think it did. It’s weak, but it’s still there.”

         Bone thought for a moment, he noticed earlier that he’d been more receptive to your emotions. “Then tha hell ye wanna goe in me mooth again for?”

         He secretly hoped you would though. You tasted disgusting, but the way you trusted him as you squirmed in his mouth, and feeling your texture on his tongue… It just itched a new kind of pleasure for him.

         “Maybe we can make it stronger! You might have to swallow me, but it doesn’t hurt to try.”

         His eyes popped slightly, his tail twitched, he gulped nervously as he rubbed at his throat; a tent threatened to form in his loins. He trusts meh to swallow?

         “Y’know mah stomach tends to hurt wha’ goes into it?” He asked.

         You rolled your eyes. “I know, just don’t take too long to throw me up.”

         “...Yar okay with thah?”

         “Of course,” you said, “I tried something similar with Thorn—“

         “THAS RIGHT, AH ‘MEMBER NOW.”

         You bit your tongue. “B-But it worked! I was able to see what he saw! I was able to do it with Mishka too without being swallowed!” You paused for a moment.

         Bone’s face screamed as if it said: REALLY? AGAIN? He withheld his growl. He felt a tad betrayed, though he did understand where you were coming from. Taking a deep breath, he rubbed his chin. “Thah does soond like ah good wey to keep ye safe…”

         You jumped eagerly. “Exactly! And I can help you figh—“

         “If ah doent get knocked out ar die. It be ah weyst if ye got added to me arse fat ar suffocated.”

         “What? No! C’mon, I can help!” You begged.

         He shook his head. “Thar ain’t noe reason to put ye in mor’ danger like that.”

         “Fine! Let’s try your balls then!”

         He nonchalantly crossed his legs, praying you didn’t notice. But the thought made him crave for it, he wondered what squeezing you in would be like. He’d only wrapped you in his sheathe once, and he could barely contain himself then. One thing was for sure, you sure as hell weren’t going down in clothes.

         But he shook his head. “Neigh! Ye cood still suffocate in thar, ar geht stuck! Ah’ve noe reason to risk thah!” Truth be told, that wasn’t the real issue. This was a matter of pride, how could he protect you if he couldn’t protect himself? He needed to uphold his dignity.

         “Maybe not you, but I do! I can’t let you keep risking your life like this!” you shouted.

         A hearty chuckle escaped him. His eye stung even more, he lodged snow into the socket to ease the itching. You cringed at the sight, hissing sympathetically.

         He spoke. “Since wehn do ah need yar permission t’die in battle? Worry ‘bout yerself, lad.”

         You were redder than a tomato, blood boiling. “FOR FUCK SAKES! BONE, JUST THIS ONCE, TAKE ME SERIOUS!”

         This took him by surprise. You were tired of the stubborn tiger pushing you to the sidelines. You have a chance to prove your worth, and he still refuses to make it easy for you.

         “I don’t want you dead! Damn, you are DENSE, but you should know by now that I care about you!”

         His lips curled ever so slightly. “Pup… ahm glad… But, ye doent need—“

         “I’m not taking ‘no’ for an answer!”

         His good eye softened, glistening from tears he restrained, the salt burning in his other. He closed them, not able to look his human in the face. “Ah stole ye from yer pops, threatened to eatcha’, an’ putcha’ in danger mor’ than ah can count…”

         You punched into his palm, not breaking your gaze. “That doesn’t matter, and I’m not asking anymore! I’m not gonna risk my best friend ever again!” Bone and Thorn had been the ONLY friends you’ve had besides your father.

         He looked so defeated, his posture slumped. “...Then, as me friend… ye know tha greatest honour ah Smilotuk can ask fah is to die in bat—“

         “FUCK HONOUR! IT’S YOU THAT MATTERS, NOT THAT, DUMBASS!”

         You felt his palms shake, his ears flopped back from his sagging face. He snorted as his breath quivered, damn salt... He was barely keeping himself together, tears threatening to overflow. You wondered if you had taken things too far. Then his forehead fell into you, rubbing against you.

         He whimpered. “Yer the dumbass, Pup… Ye doent understand wha’ loss is…”

         He nudged harder, your knees searched for balance under the weight, your wingspan not even reaching close to the width of his forehead. The gesture was not lost on you. Affection, trust, and claiming one’s territory. You closed your eyes as you leaned into the embrace, breathing in his musk as you stroked his fur.

         “I’m protecting you for now on, that’s a promise.” You whispered.

         Liquid trailed down his face. “Thank ye… Thank ye so much, Pup.”


To be continued...
11113121121111121111111121211211131211.title: Safe back home?

111131211211111211111111212112111312111.content:
A crack ricocheted through pine trees, suddenly you found yourself plummeting headfirst into snow. You caught a glimpse of Bone spewing blood, his tusk shattered in pieces. The snow quietly cushioned your fall.
         “BONE!”
         Disoriented, you climbed out and raced towards Bone, not even thinking about the current threat, only worried about your hurt friend. Fragments of stone lie buried in the white, from a Smilotuk slingshot no doubt. Fire shot up your spine that ached at your fingertips; you frantically scanned behind yourself and met the gaze of glowing ice-blue eyes. Burning with hatred, they were affixed on Bone’s collapsed form. You jumped as they flicked to you, the cold bitingly painful. But as their sharp pupils jabbed into you, they trembled. The brows lifted, the irises shifting from blue to yellow as the pupils rounded. A familiar elderly figure with silver fur unwrapped itself from the foliage.
         “Ma’… son? Is it truly ye, m’son?”
         Gilron fell to his knees, dropping a ‘Y’ shaped tool, a hand quivered as it reached out to you, the other covering his slacked jaw. He dragged himself towards you, inspecting you. Exposing his palms in a welcome, his jagged teeth unveiled into a wide brim smile as his eyes swelled.
         “…Dad? Is that… you?” But something was off.
         He opened his arms. “Come to meh, m’boy!”
         With reckless abandoned you ran to his embrace, forgetting the situation at hand.
         STOP. A voice spoke to you.
         An electric jolt singed your skin as it coiled around you, pinning your feet in place.
         THIS FOOL HAS FALLEN, A THREAT HE IS ALL NOW.
         Images flashed in your mind, too fast to make any sense. You felt the itch of all your sweat glands opening up at once; one image was vivid enough to make out. A sabre skull being crushed underfoot as pine tree needles melted and the earth beneath turned to coal.
         “M’boy, what is’tha matter? Whey have ye stopped?”
         You didn’t respond.
         That voice…
         It was like the wind itself whistled to you in tongues. That couldn’t just be in your head, right? But your father didn’t hear it; you’ve never heard anything like that; all emotion had been abruptly sucked out of you.
         Why did it call him a threat?
         You knew your father’s love was real, so why did something feel so wrong?
         He whimpered. “Jus’ come to meh, please… Ah jus’ nee’ta hold someone again.”
         You stood there squinting. You saw how frayed and matted his once brilliant fur had become; silver stained with dry blood. Gilron would never neglect himself like that, he always kept it pristine with the familiar sandpaper tongue that cleaned you every night. But even his tongue looked paler, he clearly dropped some weight as well. You wondered if your separation caused this. Either way, he was deteriorating.
         “WHEY DO YE HESITATE!?” His roar rippled through your body.
         You flinched. “D-Dad… Are you alright? You don’t… look well.”
         He reeked overwhelmingly of iron as the wind whipped the odor in your direction; his once sweet scent nowhere to be found.
         “Nonsense! Yer mind is toying with ye yet again, boy! As a wee cub, ye’d always rest on me chest, for ye feared monsters tha' didnae exist!”
         You backed a few paces.
         Gilron’s palm was stretched out waiting for you as he lied belly first in snow, he tapped his fingers frantically.
         “Hurry along now, m’boy! Thar is much weh must discuss regarding the future of ar tribe.”
         Your breathing picked up pace on its own, you took deep breaths to lower it.
         Why am I afraid of him?
         Bone coughed and wheezed; you remembered your injured friend. The sudden realization of who threw the stone was clear. But earlier when he looked at you… those eyes. You rushed backed to the unconscious tiger’s face.
         “DAD! WHY’D YOU SHOOT BONE?! HE’S ONE OF US! HE WAS HELPING ME GET BACK!” you cried
You lifted an eyelid open, but the eyeball rolled back. You felt the hot moist of Bone’s faint breaths.
         “WE GOTTA HELP HIM!”
         Gilron’s face soured, pupils shrinking at the sight of his adversary.
         “Have ye… betrayed meh as well, boy?” he mumbled. He clenched his eyes and shook his head, knuckling himself in the temple. He denied the thought and hoped you weren’t listening, but you just barely picked up on it.
         “…What?”

To be continued...
111131211211111211111111212112111312111.title: His Return.

1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.content:
He sighed, “nothin’.” Shifting closer, he stared into your eyes. “Listen carefully, son. Bone isa traitor, ‘e has allied with the Marimiut, THOSE BEASTS! The ones tha’ nearly wiped us out, an’ killed yer birth parents.”
         You stagger. “W-What’re you saying?! That makes no sense— you said they froze to death!”
         He raised his palms. “Ah wall explain everythin’—”
         “So, you lied?!”
         “Only b’cos ah had well intentioned reasons t’do so, m’boy! Being killed bah one of those beasts isa grizzly demise…”
         You point at yourself with a thumb. “Well I happened to meet some of those BEASTS, and I know they wouldn’t attack without a reason! That sounds more like a vagrant I keep hearing about!”
         “Neigh, son,” he shook his head, “ah know the difference too well. Vagrants cannae think the same as ye and ah, buh those other beasts are more than capable! They were aware of thar actions when they attacked ar’ clan when ah was a wee cub like yerself. They killed mah father b’cos he grew fond of hoomans!”
         “Gramps?” you were drawn closer by his last statement, “you told me gramps never even seen a human— was that a lie too?!”
         He exhaled. “Ah meant what ah said when ah said ah was well intentioned hiding the truth from ye… Mah father rightfully challenged those beasts when they demanded ar’ humans be surrendered, OUR KIN!”
         A human has no owner.
         “’E died in glory atop thar lands tha’ day, along with most of ar’ once great clan. Those feral savages av’ a tribe killed as many of us as they could b’fah they ate every human mah father protected…”
         You furrowed a snow-coated brow, the chill nipping at your ears. “That’s how… my parents died?”
         He chuckled. “Have ye ever listened carefully when ah tell ye to listen carefully? Ah was a mere lad, ye weren’t even born bah the time ah was yer grandfather’s age. Buh when ‘e passed to the land hereafter, the last av’ us scattered far and wide, forming new clans, like weh the Kojottr. All the newly placed Dirdachs would’av seen hoomans as a liability, others would’av been too young to remember; but ah neva’ forgot… An’ what weh all refused to forget was ar hatred for the Marimiut.”
         You bit your lip, clenched your fists, and looked to the ground. You knew you couldn’t convince Gilron to ally with the Marimiut no matter what you said. But still…
         I have to try!
         You looked up. “Maybe for the Marimiut of back then… but they shouldn’t be blamed for the mistakes of their forefathers! The younger ones I met were gentle and curious, they at least deserve a chance!”
         Gilron spoke, deadpanned. “Would ye allow meh to tell ye how ah found ye then?”
         Your heart skipped a beat, he hadn’t told the truth about that yet. He took your silence as confirmation, propping himself on his elbows.
         “When they were strong, the Amaruq shared in me late father’s ambition. They knew the heights the ancient Marimiut once reached, desirin’ to soar to those heights an’ b’com as great as they once were.”
         Your teeth clattered; you rubbed your hands like sticks for a fire. “A-As great as they once were?” you huffed.
         “Oh? Yer new mates neglected to inform ye? A surprise it’s not, they preyed upon yer ignorance. Not tha’ they would share secrets outside thar oon… much less a hooman.”
         “Well... some of them hate humans a lot, that much was clear.”
         “Ye ever queried whey? It’s b’cos in the years of ar earliest ancestors, hoomans elevated ‘em to the highest echelon av the natural order, ar wha’ legend says ah suppose. Then inexplicably, everythin’ they built fell ova’night, an’ the world as they knew it was lost forever, an’ weh were thrown into the dark ages.”
         You scratched your head. “That makes even less sense— if we made them so powerful, why do they hate us so much? How do you know any of this is true?”
         “As ah said, these were stories mah father an’ all his forefathers before him passed down. From what ah know, Marimiut fah whateva’ reason believe hoomans cause ‘em to b’com vagrants, an’ blame yer kind for the fall of thar ancestors. Fah many generations they eradicated hoomans when yer kind suddenly started reappearing, the fools believin’ they were preventin’ another 'great collapse.'
         “What even is a vagrant? I keep hearing about them over and over again, but I’m not even sure what they are.”
         “We wall come back to tha’ when it’s important. What ye need to understand is that those overgrown yetis believe that a select few hoomans born have the power to destroy ‘em again. Ah don’t understand whey ar how, buh mah father, and later the Amaruq, were convinced o’ this as well. Ah warned the Amaruq to proceed cautiously, an’ even offered to shelter their hoomans if they were discovered. Buh in thar arrogance, not only did they laugh meh away, but they also challenged the Marimiut directly.”
         You winced, already knowing how this story would pan out.
         They like us fractured into the many tribes they ar’ now. Ah shared mah father’s compassion, ah returned there an’ found only a single survivor of the hundreds of humans they protected. You."
         Your teeth clenched with the pressure of a thousand jaws. In silence, a vein nearly burst from your forehead, you wanted to kick something as hard as you could. Only one question came to mind.
         “Dad… who was their Nanuk when they attacked?”
         “If bah Nanuk ye mean Dirdach, then ah believe ‘e would’ve been known as Great Beast Kilak.”

To be continued...
1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.title: Who's the real enemy?

1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.content:
“Now do ye understand whey ah despise ‘em so? They ar’ WORSE than vagrants! Weh cannot evah make peace with MONGROLS such as they! The younger of thar kin wall grow up no different from thar elders, they always do!”

         You fell bum first on the snow, the shock made the lethal frost unnoticeable. You had no words. Gilron wagered he could get closer now, he shuffled his legs towards you and squatted on his heels.

         “Aht’s not yer fault, mah son. Ah too let me compassion ovahpower mah self, an’ allowed this sympathizer o’ monsters within ar’ ranks.” He pointed at Bone with his chin.

         You shot up. “Dad, wait! T-That would make me a sympathizer also! Bone was just as ignorant and just as compassionate as I was!”

         “Ye still ar’ ignorant, mah lit’al monkeh. This traitor has known ‘is ole’ life. He was always av their cloth, an’ lied the day he came to us, barely a cub, an knelt t’both knees an begged meh t’shelter him. Ah should’av ripped ‘is head off his neck then an’ thar!”

         Gilron lifted himself to both feet, you waved your arms frantically.

         “Why take him in if you were just gonna kill him?!”

         Your father groaned. “Weh only took ‘im in b’cos he claimed he was a victim of those beasts like us! Ah always thought it suspicious, but not once did ah imagine an atrocity like this! Mah suspicions war’ proven correct when tha’ damn Shaman returned.”

         “Y-You mean Thorn? Please tell me he’s okay!”

         He scoffed. “Ah care not war’ tha’ fool has scurried off to, perhaps with those other traitors…” He smirked, “wise move, ah had already decided ah would beh the wun to send ‘im to the land hereafter.”

         You shook your head. “Thorn hasn’t betrayed anyone! Him and Bone went out of their way to try to get the lost humans, and they kept me alive! They put your interests first! They deserve a second chance!”

         He knelt and plucked Bone’s spear from the snow. “Thornfur, perhaps, af the Shaman had not fleed in disgrace wih’ ‘is tail between ‘is legs. Buh this fool…” he pointed at Bone with the spear, “this fool received many chances in ‘is pathetic life. Now ‘e must repent.”

         The cloth of your pantleg cracked like a sheet of ice as you trudged your way in front of Gilron’s clawed toes, your wingspan open in a fruitless attempt to halt him. He looked into your eyes as he tilted his head, but instead of anger, he smiled. Your spine prickled.

         “Worreh not for’a fool, mah boy, lest ye become wun yerself.” He was a mountain that towered over you with menace. “Ye’av spent too long outside, come to meh b’for the spirit o’ winter tries to rip ye from meh.”

         He reached to pick you up, not waiting for you any longer, but you rolled away. His forehead overflowed with wrinkles, his eyes sharpening once more.

         “I won’t, not unless Bone comes with us! He protected me and brought me back to you, I won’t let you kill him!”

         A low growl escaped him; his tusks threatened to reveal the gums underneath. “YE won’t let MEH? Even though ‘e tore ye away from meh, treated ye like a play toy, an’ tried to murder meh dozens upon dozens av times?! Ye would trust a TRAITOR ovah YE OWN FATHAH?!” He stopped for a moment and tried breathing. “…Ah wall give ye a single chance an’ no more, COME ‘ERE, NOW.”

         “Bu—”

         “ENOUGH BUTS, BOY— AHM NOT ASKING ANYMOR’.”

         You could hear the ear-wringing grinding of his rows upon rows of sharp teeth; you couldn’t hide your wincing. But you stood your ground, your face wrinkled, your eyebrows slanted, and you puffed your chest.

         “NO! NOT WITHOUT BONE!”

         He roared so gutturally your ears popped and rang from the sheer force. You felt yourself almost fly in the air, his fist made a steaming crater past the snow and into the dirt below, barely missing you.

         “AH TOLD YE NOW YE WEE LITTLE SHITE!!!”

         You pissed yourself, your skin probably grateful for the sudden but short increase of warmth. You crawled away, water draining from your eyes like a river.

         “D-D-D-D-D—" but you couldn’t even mutter the words, you felt yourself choke on your breath. “P-P-P-P-PLEASE S-S-STOP!”

         The redness of his gums was fully exposed, his pupils were small and filled with hate. The eyes shifted from yellow to black, the pupils grew to encompass the entirety of his eyeballs, it’s slowly formed a dark blue ring around the middle. Now the irises were blue backset by black sclera. For the first time in your life, your father made you genuinely fear for your life.

         “Y-Y… W-Where is my dad? Who are you!”

         In a snap, his eyes immediately went back to their normal yellow, his brow sorrowful. He refused to become the monster his son used to fear.

         “F-FORGIVE MEH!” he tried covering his eyes, but nothing could stop the way they stabbed into you, “AH AM STILL YER FATHA’! YE HAVE NO REASON T’FEAR MEH, ME PRECIOUS SON!”

         He tried reaching a palm towards you, but you already made a mad dash away. You tasted the salt trail of your tears on your tongue, it evaporated. Tripping, you planted face first into the permafrost, but quickly recovered. You were on fire as your bare palms crawled through the deathtrap of white. You knew what was happening, it was one of the signs that your warmth was dangerously low. Everything becomes suddenly hot, and it’s so unbearable you want to strip off all your clothes to stop the burning. You knew if you did this, you’d be a goner. Resisting the urge made you want to chomp your tongue off.

         “EHT’S NOT SAFE FOR’A CREATURE SUCH AS YERSELF! COME TO YER PAPA, B’FOR THE COLD CLAIMS YE!”

         The weight on your heart dragged you down, not even being able to trust the giant you once called ‘Father.’ You shook the tears off; Bone was your last place of safety now. You hid behind his shoulder, cowering at your imposing father, ready to pluck you at a moment’s notice.

         He approached you. “MAH SON, AH BEG OF YE! AH CANNAE BARE A MOMENT LONGER WITHOUT YE!”

         “GO AWAY!” you screamed.

         You covered your ears and clamped your eyes shut, you waited for the hand to inevitably take you. But suddenly, the rapid blowing of hot air washed over you, you heard the fast beating of an amped heartbeat. When you opened your eyes, Bone’s good eye was wide open and radiating red, his hand crushing your father’s wrist as his claws dug into it.

         “THAS MAH LOVER YAR SCARING, YAH PURE MUTANT!” Bone bellowed.




To be continued...
1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.title: Where's my dad?

1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.content:
Gilron’s eyes once again faded back to black and then blue; Bone kicked him with the force of a horse and cracked your father’s ribs, but Gilron, unfazed, held on firmly. He swung at Bone with his claws, ready to shred him to bits, but his hand froze. He tried forcing his hand to move with all his might but could not. Bone side eyed you, seeing you with your eyes rolled back, veins popping from your skull, and arms held out as if you held something by strings. They both looked astonished, they knew you were the cause of this. In Gilron’s heart he was not angry at his son, he was proud. Bone took the opportunity to plant both feet into Gilron this time, launching him into a tree.

         “HRRMPH” you gasped, feeling what your father felt.

         You came to; Bone was limping as fast as he could with you in palm. Blood spilled in large drops, splattering on you as well; his lungs rattled with labored wheezes.

         Protect Pup!

         Protect Pup!

         Protect Pup!

         Bone repeated the mantra in his head, all of which you could hear. You were admittedly confused, as you thought the link would’ve broken off after he’d been knocked out cold. He struggled to run in a straight path, his determination forcing him to run on his injured leg. A whipping in the air and zooming of a high-speed object startled you both, you saw the projectile crash into snow.

         Gilron’s roar reverberated through the forest of snow sprinkled pine needles.

         “BONE SNAPPAH!!!”

         You looked back and saw the blur that was your father running on all fours with a spear strapped to his back, a knife in his maw, and the slingshot in his hand as he sprinted. You lost track of him as he darted above, covered by greenery and the night sky.

         “SHITE!!!” Bone panted.

         Not good!

         Not good!

         NOT GOOD!

         You heard his thoughts once more express. He couldn’t maintain his pace; his leg would give out sooner or later. He slouched on his tread, just about ready to fall. Then he became lighter, as if someone piggybacked him from their shoulders. Bone watched himself run; the pain numbed now, soon enough he was at full speed as his muscles flared with vigor.

         Stay with me big guy! I can’t do this alone!

         Your voice had echoed in his head. He could finally catch his breath, a well needed break. The pain was still there, but it was bearable; he finally realized you were sharing his burden. A thought occurred to him though.

         Whey… do ye smell an’ taste like piss?

         “GIVE MEH MA’SON, TRAITOR!!!”

         Gilron’s voice encroached ever closer. Bone watched as you commanded his arm to plop your tiny form into his maw with reckless abandon; you felt a brilliantly warm tingle caress your body; a close save from being frozen. Bone made sure his tongue secured you and that he wouldn’t swallow by accident.

         You spoke to yourself.

         Dad, I don’t wanna kill you… Please… PLEASE still be in there!

         Bone’s ears folded sympathetically. “Ah… Cannae believe a wee hooman savin’ m’life right now.”

         This helped you snap out of it for a moment. You spoke using his mouth. “Wouldn’t be the first time, you dumb cat!”

         Both of you were taken aback hearing Bone speak without his dialect.



What happens next?
1111312112111112111111112121121113121111.title: You dumb cat!

choices: Noble, who lived in a villa with an Anthro noble
Carpenter, who lived in a workhouse with Anthro Blacksmiths and Workers
Farmer, living outside the city with an Anthro Farmer.
112.content: Records indicate that humans and Anthro's have been in cooperation since the dawn of time, helping each other develop new ways to survive and thrive. When Anthro's discovered Animal Husbandry and Farming, Society went from day to day survival to civilization. Anthro tribes came together, no longer sticking to living around their own species, and began interacting with each other on a personal level. Humans of course followed along and became active, valued members of these new societies. And though they lacked Strength, they did have numbers and intelligence to make an impact on the progress of civilization. Present day found you in an empire built on philosophy and marble, much akin to the roman and Greek empires of old. Humans had their own homes and settlements, but most preferred to just live in an Anthro friend or lovers house. You were a human....
112.title: The Bronze Age

1122.content: You sewed together last of your leather for the day, wiping your brow and tuning out the constant hammering and grinding noises of the workhouse. You had been here for three years since you moved from the countryside to the city. Here at this workshop, Anthros and humans worked together on building materials and basic clothing for the populace. You had a name, but the humans and Anthros took to calling you Fleece since you were pretty decent at sewing. A hand slammed down near you and a familiar face glowered at you, the leader of the house and for some reason he didn't look too pleased at the moment. He was a...
1122.title: Carpenter, who lived in a workhouse with Anthro...

choices: Prince, adopted by the King when you parent's passed
Servant, working in the King's castle
Peasant, scraping by to make a living among the giants.
113.content: Ages have passed and humanity and Anthrokind have thrived across the planet of Sedimar, establishing empires and kingdoms that dotted the planet's landscapes and reached almost every corner of it. Anthro's built great strongholds, to show wealth and to protect themselves from rival kingdoms. Humans found themselves at the right hand of Anthros the whole way, but discrimination showed its face too humankind in these dark ages. Humans rarely, if ever, held any form of power in this society, as it was established by strength, and species like Bear, Elk, Wolves, and Lions usually were found to be the royal family of a kingdom due to this. Humans did hold nobility occasionally, but usually found themselves on the lower rungs of the pecking order, taking vocations like craftsman and farmer. You however were a human...
113.title: Medieval Times

1131.content:
Prince, finding your way into the royal family of a large kingdom that ran along the coast of a great continent. You had been adopted into the family five years ago at the age of thirteen, when your blood family, nobles that were fervently loyal to the King you now call father, were murdered by a rival kingdoms agents in an attempt to stage a civil dispute among the lords of your kingdom. The agents missed you however and you reported the act to the king personally, saving him a lot of trouble and calming the turmoil that the murder of your family had caused the kingdom. The king rewarded you by taking you into his house, and naming you a prince with his blessing. You were third in line for the crown, having two older brothers, but that worried you little, you were just glad to have a family.

         Today you found yourself in court, seated in your throne that was fastened to the right armrest of your oldest brothers chair. His chair was to the left of his fathers chair, and your other brothers chair was on the right side of the kingdom throne. Today's hearings were mostly property disputes and something about trade tariffs. You looked on at some fox that was explaining his proposal without seeming to take a breath.

         "....And that is why your Grace I think funding the city docks to be expanded into a deeper part of the bay would be beneficial to trade and the common folks." The fox said, finally catching his breath before bowing his head, his eyes glancing at your father with a look of awe. You turn to look at your father slowly to see him stand to give his decree. He stood to his full height, dwarfing most in the room, showing himself to be...
1131.title: Prince, adopted by the King when you parent'...

choices: Your father takes you with him to bathe
Mot takes you to the study
Verdi takes you to his chambers
11311.content:
Polar bear. King Styrke let out a sigh before addressing the room of some 200 more attendees awaiting audience.

         "You speak purpose with your request, and know the crown will fund the expansion of the docks following your instruction, I see no fault in the expansion of the harbor. You are dismissed Verdun." Your father said nodding at the fox, who took a deep bow before walking out of the throne room. You observe your adoptive father, complimenting him mentally, as he wore a form fitting purple military jacket with slate gray tights, emphasizing his large butt and package. The jacket was trimmed with gold that accentuated the crown he wore. His feet were adorned with polished black boots. No doubt he was the very picture of authority. You and your brothers wore a very similar outfit but instead of purple your jacket was a dark blue with silver accents instead of gold and the crown you wore was smaller and silver. Your father reclaimed his seat and the castle steward called the next citizen to step forward to address their grievance. You sigh and prop your head on you palm, bored out of your mind, a large digit tapped your head, knocking you forward a bit and causing your crown to fall in your lap. You look back with a scowl at your oldest brother Mot, who was looking down at you sternly.

         "Pay attention and learn a thing or two about ruling Hap, you may need it one day." The white bear said looking back up at the court hearing. Mot was roughly the size of your father, and was the crown prince, signified by the Amethyst inlaid in the head of his crown. His muscles swelled beneath his blue jacket and a prominent bulge was visible through his tights. You put your crown back on.

         "What, you and Verdi plan on dying on me soon?" You say looking back at him from your chair. Mot sighed, not looking back down at his kid brother, and spoke.

         "Best to be prepared for anything, now be quiet and listen or father will hear about your failure to listen to the people." You snapped back forward, fathers anger could be vicious, you'd only been the victim of it twice, and it never ended well. The hearings went on, finally coming to an end halfway into the afternoon. When the last commoner walked out of the throne room and the doors shut behind her, Verdi jumped up and stretched, letting out a sigh before clasping his hands together and turning towards his family.

         "Well that was truly a long court, shall we adjourn for some dinner?" Verdi said with a smirk he never took off his face. He was 20, as Mot was 23, and your father being a respectable 48. Verdi had the same build as his brother and father, and had the same great ass and bulge as well. You truly felt like an ant among these gods. King Styrke sighed and turned in his chair to face You and Mot, his eyes saying everything. Mot sighed, rolling his eyes.

         "Very well, lets get some dinner and review all the cases that have transpired today." Mot said standing up, casting you in his shadow. Your father seemed pleased by the answer and turned to the Steward Caine, a thin jackal that had been in this castle as long as Styrke has.

         "Lord Caine would you see that dinner finds its way into the dining room shortly? Me and my sons shall be in the dueling room, please inform us when it is served." You sat up as Caine left the room.

         "Are we to witness Mot and Verdi's swordsmanship in a bout father?" You say excitedly, you always enjoyed watching your brothers spar, wishing you could join them. Your father nodded at you with a smile, standing up and making his way out of the room, Verdi followed close behind. Mot offered you his palm, and you climbed on and were whisked out of the room. You looked up at your brother, who was obviously distracted in thought, probably processing all the interactions that had occurred that day, you thought it best not to ask him pointless questions. After a short walk you found yourself in a large room that had plush chairs lining its walls with a few tables between them. The middle of the room was bare of furniture, and one corner had an assortment of practice weapons. Verdi was standing near them, stripping off his jacket and crown, leaving his torso bare to the stone room. His white fur was bright against the dull grey stone, and his muscles underneath looked as if they were made by the very stones of the keep. His tights did little to hide the outline of his large sheath and balls beneath the cotton and silk fabric. His white stubby tail stuck out above his globular covered cheeks as he drew a wooden longsword from a rack. Your father appeared next to Mot with his palm outstretched, without a word you were transferred into your dad's rough palm as he walked over and took a seat in one of the chairs, he placed you on his thigh and you tried to ignore the large bulge he had between his legs.

         "Mot, why don't you show me how well your spearmanship has become." Your dad says with a lazy smile. Mot nodded, stripping to mirror Verdi before grabbing a wooden spear from the rack. Your brothers took their respective positions on opposite ends of the room, they turned and faced each other, waiting your fathers signal.

         "Begin!" Your dad commands. Verdi approached Mot cautiously, obviously at a disadvantage due to Mot's reach. Verdi took a feint before coming in with a swing from the other direction. Mot smacked the blade away and with the same motion brought the butt of the spear up between Verdi's legs, pegging him right in his nethers. Verdi gasped and dropped to his knees, cupping himself, only to look up and find Mot's spearhead an inch from his eye. Your father chuckled slightly and groaned.

         "Verdi, when faced with a spear, you want to get inside his reach as quick as possible but also not overextend yourself, fail to do so and you'll end up where you are now. Again!" Your father shouted. This went on for another 30 minutes, the results being similar almost every time, which was frustrating your father slightly.

         "Verdi, take Hap and observe me." Your father said standing up and setting you in the imprint his ass left in the seat. You're looking at me like I don't do this and walk around the house in the nude anyway."

Leaving his junk exposed behind you. He picked his mug back up and sipped before looking at Marcus and winking. Marcus sat there for a second before commenting.

A few hours passed as did a sort car ride and you found yourself on the shoulder of Marcus as he and Vance weaved their way through a crowd of Anthros perusing various stalls and grills. Marcus wore a jacket with sweatpants, while Vance had sunglasses on and was sporting his usual tank top and board shorts, cold air not really bothering him much. You always enjoyed these kind of things, and liked to get a look at the local species of Anthros that preferred this climate. There were actually a good bit of bears, black and brown, but none quite like Vance in color. Cervines were also common, with many Black and White tail deer, a handful of Rocky mountain Elk, and one or two moose towering over the crowd. A Cougar would eventually pass as well. There were a few exotic species as well, not common to the area. You saw a Rhino, and at one point you caught the glimpse of some marine mammal that may have been a seal, but he disappeared into the crowd before you got a decent look. Marcus made his way to an elevated platform that hosted the human section of the bar-b-que, the platform was quite large, with human facilities and stalls. Some humans looked on with interest as Marcus set you down and began to coo over you, much to your embarrassment.

         "....and if you need me or Vance call us. We don't need another incident like Bagroi Beach-"

         "Dad I'm fine, I can take care of myself, I'm eighteen not five." You say and wave him off. He hovered for a second but the smell of something soon pulled him away.
         You turn around to find many people looking at you, and you shrug. Though Marcus had been talking at a quiet level, probably half the people here caught that you're from an anthro family, there were many reasons they have such a fascination with it, but you let them wonder.
         A notification pinged and you saw that Vance had transferred a good bit of money into your account so you could make purchases, and you went on to one of the first stalls. You dealt with the usual questions; Is that your dad? Is that really your dad? Do you have another dad? All the questions that usually were asked to any human with a male anthro as a parent. Though the way they asked seem to imply more than just disbelief, like they wanted to know if Marcus and Vance was really your fathers, as if they could actually be biological. You didn't think it was possible, but the rest of humanity kept broaching you with the same questions.
         You found a seat in a dining area that was right next to a railing overlooking an anthro table, purposefully set up so human and anthro friends/family could dine near each other. You sat there so if Vance and Marcus come along you could be near them, but also because most humans didn't sit so close to the anthros, leaving you without the invasive questioning. Most humans lived their lives with anthros in the background, having only one or two that they interact with on the regular, people like you that spent more time with anthros than with your own kind were pariahs to some degree, mainly by your choice. Humans were fascinated and terrified of anthros, and a human that lives among them is questioned to insanity about anthro living.
         Movement to your right jostled you out of your daydream and you turned to look at who you though was one of your dad's. You blink when you find yourself looking at a Leopard Seal. As if sensing your sudden focus, he turned at you and blinked before speaking, his voice husky,

         "Oh I'm sorry man, I didn't see that there was a human here. Are you waiting on someone on my side? Sorry I can move..." He said picking his plate back up and beginning to stand.

         "N-no not particularly, I'm just sitting away from other people so they don't bug me, you're fine." You say meeting his icy blue eyes.
         The seal falters, and decides to sit back down, a gracious smile on his face.

         "So uh, are you famous or something?" He said inquiring, then paused. "Sorry you just said you got away from people because they're bugging you and then I go and do that very thing." He said looking away, causing you to laugh in amusement.

         "You're fucking with me right? That's so ludicrous, how does a german shepherd, which is a guy. And a Grizzly, which is a GUY, have a human biologically?" You ask turning towards the Seal, you just met this guy and he was already fucking with you. Maybe coming to this was a mistake. The Leopard seal rose his palms up in a defensive pose.

         "Calm down, little dude, I didn't mean any offense. But you seem to be in denial about such a thing, ask them later about it, there's no way they DON'T know about that outcome." He said turning back to his food as if he didn't just possibly shatter your entire existence. It wasn't his fault, he seemed to genuinely think you were born from one of your dads.
         You pull out your phone and do some digging, needing to find out if this is some kind of sick joke that people are playing to discriminate or something. But sure enough it didn't take long to find medical statements and articles pertaining to the very thing the leopard seal just proposed.

         "Hol-lee-Shit" You say out loud, the Leopard seal turning and looking at you again.

         "Oh...you were telling the truth that you didn't believe me....yeah there's always been the speculation humans are from the unions of male anthros, and the fact that theres a small chance like 1 in 10000, for a human to be created from homosexual copulation." The seal rambled off, but you were too busy having an existential crisis.
          You had always believed you had been adopted for some odd reason by Vance and Marcus, but they had never said they adopted you. They seemed to have left out the part where they themselves had brought you into this world as well. A lot of things made since now that you knew they were your biological fathers though.          "Okay lets talk about something else, anything to get my mind off of that. Who are you? What do you do for a living?" You say to the seal, who still sat there with his mouth forming the next word he was going to speak before you cut him off. He smiled fondly at that.

         "Well my name is Butch, and I fancy myself a photographer slash artist. I'm staying in a cabin up near a pond trying to get better at sketching boreal landscapes." He said with a toothy smile, his voice sounding more like a bouncers rather than an aspiring artist.

         "Sounds like you're staying where me and my folks are." You say, instantly regretting mentioning them as the thoughts came flooding back.

         "Ahhh, thatShepherd and Grizzly are your dad's, I saw them out there on the pond yesterday, I approve of their swimming attire, I prefer just going nude myself." He said laughing.
         You chat with him for a time about what he has drawn and other small talk, and before you know it, time has flown by and your phone rings. You answer.

         "Hello?"

         "Hey bud, we're heading out, Marcus found the Beer stand and I need to get us outta here before he gets in a fight with this moose. Where are ya?" As you talk to Vance, Butch waves goodbye and walks away, knowing you knew where he lived. You were found by Vance a minute later and headed out..

Out in the water you could make out Marcus's back, and the strip of red that was his thong. Sitting crisscross on the dock was Vance, a warm toothy expression captured him looking fondly down on a space on the dock, a spot you knew you were on at the time. Finally you came upon your first corpse, it was a woman laying on her back, and where her heart was, an ice shard the color of blood shot out of her chest, her face locked into a face of anguish. You turned green and fell to your knees.

         "Please don't spoil my work station human, you'll see many more gruesome sights then this being here I promise." He said smiling, you stared in disbelief, if you had magic, and could learn it...then you could escape, and may be the only human in the world that could be a threat to Anthros everywhere. info.brief_description: Follow a human as they explore the world of Sedimar, a place inhabited by Giant Anthro's
info.description:
Welcome to Sedimar, a world where Giant anthro's rule. You follow a human male on his journey through this world, where other humans coexist with the anthro's, are slaves, or don't exist at all. Feel free to add to a chapter and turn it into an epic! Some rules to cover first before we begin.

-This is a predominantly male/male story, female interactions are okay but try to keep them to a minimum.

-Almost anything is allowed except toilet stuff, let's keep that on the low as well.

-Humans are roughly 1 inch compared to the Giant's, and they can't grow or shrink from this size.

-Spelling and grammar have to be decent, and chapters have to be at least a paragraph.

-That's all I can think of really. Enjoy!
